item.description: @RabbiPoupko @jewishmemequeen Nothing like a Navi reference to confuse certain people.
item.source:markdown: @RabbiPoupko @jewishmemequeen Nothing like a Navi reference to confuse certain people.

item.description:
@MisfitTorah Yes, but: I think it's more than about hiding a problem. I think it's about a deeply ingrained belief that only bad people do bad things, so bad-doers don't have to be treated like people.

@MisfitTorah And that bad things only happen to bad people, so people who claim to be victims are in fat bad and don't have to be treated like people.

@MisfitTorah There is an unspoken essentialism akin to the worst manifestations of the Esaf soneh at Yaakov trope.

@MisfitTorah Which is why American policing can resemble the IDF policing of the Palestinians.

@MisfitTorah And those who call for systemic change -- whether of policing, punishment, health services, or housing -- are greeted with the same unspoken disdain with which mainstream Israel treats advocates for Palestinians.

@MisfitTorah This is particularly true if those calling for such change do not look like people considered as authority figures when one was growing up -- or if they with those who associate with those who don't pass that 1940s or 50s litmus test.

@MisfitTorah This is my current monocausal explanation of why the Democratic gerontocracy is flailing the way it is.

@AkivaMCohen He may or may not honestly not know how to read a p factor. He knows his audience certainly can’t. (No shame there; I can’t really either, but I at least know my limitations.)

@AkivaMCohen But the question returns to my pinned tweet: Why have some people decided that spreading pro-virus propaganda is a good way to spend one’s life?
item.source:markdown:
@AkivaMCohen He may or may not honestly not know how to read a p factor. He knows his audience certainly can’t. (No shame there; I can’t really either, but I at least know my limitations.)
@AkivaMCohen But the question returns to my pinned tweet: Why have some people decided that spreading pro-virus propaganda is a good way to spend one’s life?

item.description:
Color me skeptical. https://t.co/nw3mNfZ9gQ

I would, though, be interested in seeing the @forward and @Foodaism do a deep dive into whether Meta׳s blocking of advertisers’ ability to target Jews has had any impact on outreach and other Jewish groups.
item.source:markdown:
Color me skeptical. https://t.co/nw3mNfZ9gQ
I would, though, be interested in seeing the @forward and @Foodaism do a deep dive into whether Meta׳s blocking of advertisers’ ability to target Jews has had any impact on outreach and other Jewish groups.

item.description: @MisfitTorah There is something to be said for practicing the battle against defensiveness when the stakes are low.
item.source:markdown: @MisfitTorah There is something to be said for practicing the battle against defensiveness when the stakes are low.

item.description:
@MisfitTorah And this is a large part of why people kvetch about trivial matters like kitniyos and chicken. Avoiding pork and oysters means trusting the Torah. Avoiding cheeseburgers means trusting all the Tanaim.

@MisfitTorah Chicken and kitniyot means choosing some rabbis over other rabbis. And the community’s mechanism for choosing which rabbis to listen to is pretty broken.

@MisfitTorah Maybe it always was, but now everyone can see it.
@SamuelSokol @haaretzcom So Brexit redux?
item.source:markdown: @SamuelSokol @haaretzcom So Brexit redux?

item.description: @MisfitTorah Be willing to think aloud publicly is risky but as someone who does it, I think worthwhile for all concerned.

item.description: Just spent 90 minutes helping my Beloved Conservative Relative reconfigure his email to adjust to his former employer’s new 2 factor authorization policies, so he can continue to send and receive emails warning that “Antifa are the new brownshirts.”
item.source:markdown: Just spent 90 minutes helping my Beloved Conservative Relative reconfigure his email to adjust to his former employer’s new 2 factor authorization policies, so he can continue to send and receive emails warning that “Antifa are the new brownshirts.”

item.description:
@bruces Did you see the reports out of Israel last week on the lifting of censorship on their autonomous drone program which dated back to the 90s?

@bruces Apparently it was a major investment designed to defend against a Syrian invasion if a return of the Golan Heights was negotiated, as seemed possible at the time.

@bruces The drones were repurposed to take out Hamas activists in the 2000 intifada, which resulted in the irony of Gazans seeing deadly drones which Israeli media couldn’t report.

@bruces Which brings to mind this 1973 Doonesbury cartoon. ￼ ￼ https://t.co/48F55HxPfL

"Merely arguing about abstract ideas" is very respectable, while actually giving a shit is not, as it taints everything you do, making you a grubby activist and not a Serious Opinion Haver." https://t.co/5bPJllXOgH

item.description:
@DandiaAsad “Will” is a very generous assumption here.

@DandiaAsad I’d like to think this is all an elaborate publicity stunt on behalf of @lavietidhar’s forthcoming novel. https://t.co/OdQMbivCGE

@DandiaAsad @lavietidhar The more frightening possibility is that MBS is loudly advertising his deep gullibility and griftability.
@Adderabbi @Eli_Rubin Wow.
item.source:markdown: @Adderabbi @Eli_Rubin Wow.

item.description:
Related: looking for someone who can draw a leprechaun reading from the Torah. My dms are open. https://t.co/SOfLFjvAkw

Note: I’m asking not for a dm of the sketch, but for your willingness and ability to take such a (paid) assignment.
